alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:48AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elk and Chautauqua Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 348 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Latham to 6 miles west of Grenola to near Grainola. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sedan, Howard, Cedar Vale, Moline, Longton, Grenola, Peru, Chautauqua, Elk Falls, Elgin, Niotaze and Hale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
